intro: Oreocharis dasyantha, commonly known as the hairy oreocharis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, white or pale green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Oreocharis dasyantha is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions.
